oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drugstores; Men
Dayton (Tenn.); Rhea County (Tenn.); Scopes, John Thomas; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interior view of Robinson's Drugstore. Shown are George W. Rappelyea, Walter White, Clay Green, F. Robinson and Owen Wasson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fred Robinson, the owner, attempted to capitalize on the trial by advertising his drugstore as the place "where it started." John Scopes and town officials willingly posed for photographs seated around the store's soda fountain. The drugstore went out; of business in 1982.
